author: @KSLA
title: Near-record warmth expected across the ArkLaTex today!
text:
SHREVEPORT, La. (KSLA) - Happy Sunday! Today‚Äôs highs will be approaching or breaking daily record highs around the area. Highs will be ranging from the lower 90s to the north to the upper 90s, maybe even the triple digits, near east Texas! This is mainly due to compressional heating from the incoming cold front from the northwest, which is destined to bring us more fall-like weather.
The incoming cold front will remain dry and will move southeastward across most of the country, sending our highs into the 80s by Monday and Tuesday and into the 70s by Wednesday! Our lows will also drop into the 40s for a couple of mornings before rising back into the 50s later in the week. Something exciting to look forward to if you are tired of the warm weather!
Today, though, there is an elevated risk for wildfires around the ArkLaTex. This is caused by breezy conditions, dry vegetation, and relatively low humidity. Some key things to watch out for today, and the next few days, are properly disposing of cigarettes and avoiding activities involving an open flame or spark. Stay safe and enjoy your Sunday!
Copyright 2024 KSLA. All rights reserved.

Google Faces Trial For Collecting Data On Users Who Opted Out
Published by
Slashdot
on Fri, 10 Jan 2025
An anonymous reader quotes a report from Ars Technica: A federal judge this week rejected Google's motion to throw out a class-action lawsuit alleging that it invaded the privacy of users who opted out of functionality that records a users' web and app activities. A jury trial is scheduled for August 2025 in US District Court in San Francisco. The lawsuit concerns Google's Web & App Activity (WAA) settings, with the lead plaintiff representing two subclasses of people with Android and non-Android phones who opted out of tracking. "The WAA button is a Google account setting that purports to give users privacy control of Google's data logging of the user's web app and activity, such as a user's searches and activity from other Google services, information associated with the user's activity, and information about the user's location and device," wrote (PDF) US District Judge Richard Seeborg, the chief judge in the Northern District Of California. Google says that Web & App Activity "saves your activity on Google sites and apps, including associated info like location, to give you faster searches, better recommendations, and more personalized experiences in Maps, Search, and other Google services." Google also has a supplemental Web App and Activity setting that the judge's ruling refers to as "(s)WAA." "The (s)WAA button, which can only be switched on if WAA is also switched on, governs information regarding a user's '[Google] Chrome history and activity from sites, apps, and devices that use Google services.' Disabling WAA also disables the (s)WAA button," Seeborg wrote. But data is still sent to third-party app developers through the Google Analytics for Firebase (GA4F), "a free analytical tool that takes user data from the Firebase kit and provides app developers with insight on app usage and user engagement," the ruling said. GA4F "is integrated in 60 percent of the top apps" and "works by automatically sending to Google a user's ad interactions and certain identifiers regardless of a user's (s)WAA settings, and Google will, in turn, provide analysis of that data back to the app developer." Plaintiffs have brought claims of privacy invasion under California law. Plaintiffs "present evidence that their data has economic value," and "a reasonable juror could find that Plaintiffs suffered damage or loss because Google profited from the misappropriation of their data," Seeborg wrote. The lawsuit was filed in July 2020. The judge notes that summary judgment can be granted when "there is no genuine dispute as to any material fact and the movant is entitled to judgment as a matter of law." Google hasn't met that standard, he ruled. In a statement provided to Ars, Google said that "privacy controls have long been built into our service and the allegations here are a deliberate attempt to mischaracterize the way our products work. We will continue to make our case in court against these patently false claims."Read more of this story at Slashdot.
Click here to read full news..

author: Kate Seamons with Newser.AI
title: Missing Teen Surfer Found Alive on Uninhabited Island
text: Missing Teen Surfer Found Alive on Uninhabited Island Rescuers found 19-year-old Australian Darcy Deefholts on North Solitary Island By with Posted Jul 10, 2025 8:18 AM CDT Stock images of a remote island. (Getty Images / SellOnlineMarketing) After vanishing during a solo surf session on Wednesday afternoon, a 19-year-old Australian was found alive on a remote island the next day, in what the teen's father is calling a "one in a million miracle." After Darcy Deefholts failed to return home, his family alerted authorities, prompting a search around the area of Wooli Beach, which is located 300 miles north of Sydney. That search was paused Wednesday night due to poor visibility, reports 7 News, and Darcy's dad took to Facebook to plead for help at first light. "I need boats, beach walkers, drones, 4WDs and planes," Terry Deefholts wrote. "My boy Darcy is still missing ... of course we are fearing the worst." But just an hour into the search on Thursday, crews discovered the teenager on North Solitary Island, an uninhabited island that sits about seven miles off the coast, reports CBS News. Rescue teams shared their relief online, describing themselves as "jumping for joy" at the "incredible outcome." The Guardian reports Deefholts was taken to Grafton base hospital in stable condition. "The patient is in good spirits and is being supported by family," a rep for the northern New South Wales health district said. Officials haven't detailed how Deefholts ended up on the uninhabited island or what exactly happened during his night offshore. Read These Next GOP Sen. Tillis suggests Pete Hegseth is 'out of his depth.' Former President Biden's doctor pleads the 5th. Trump put 7 more letters in the mail. Trump gives his opinion on 6 presidents of yore. author: Around the Web
title: Alarm sounded over massive database of info on Americans pushed by Biden
text: Rebeka Zeljko Daily Caller News Foundation Advancing American Freedom, a conservative group founded by former Vice President Mike Pence, is sounding the alarm about a Biden administration effort to collect Americans‚Äô private financial information, according to a memo obtained by the Daily Caller News Foundation. The [Securities and Exchange Commission](https://dailycaller.com/2024/04/26/opinion-bidens-securities-and-exchange-commission-is-after-your-privacy-brian-reardon/) (SEC) in 2012 authorized a program to make it easier for financial regulators to track transactions in U.S. markets by creating a ‚Äúconsolidated audit trail,‚Äù or CAT. This would require brokerages and exchanges to collect and report certain financial information to regulators and other financial organizations. Under the Biden administration, the SEC [approved](https://www.sec.gov/divisions/marketreg/rule613-info) a new [funding model](https://www.sec.gov/files/rules/sro/nms/2023/34-98290.pdf) for CAT in September 2023. [Get the hottest, most important news stories on the Internet ‚Äì delivered FREE to your inbox as soon as they break! Take just 30 seconds and sign up for WND's Email News Alerts!](https://www.wnd.com/newsletter-subscription/) The [AAF memo](https://advancingamericanfreedom.com/aaf-bidens-secret-massive-database-of-your-financial-holdings/) warned that the CAT program was effectively an ‚ÄúOrwellian‚Äù government database of Americans‚Äô personal information, and urged lawmakers to back a bill that would prevent the SEC from forcing financial institutions to hand over Americans‚Äô information. The bill, known as [H.R. 4551](https://www.congress.gov/bill/118th-congress/house-bill/4551) or the Protecting Investors‚Äô Personally Identifiable Information Act, was introduced by Republican Rep. [Barry Loudermilk](https://loudermilk.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=4309) of Georgia. ‚ÄúWe have witnessed abuses by other government agencies, including the IRS releasing private financial information,‚Äù AAF Chairman Marc Short told the Daily Caller News Foundation. ‚ÄúThis unconstitutional and reckless [regulatory overreach](https://dailycaller.com/2023/06/15/exclusive-rep-byron-donalds-moves-to-curb-bidens-regulatory-overreach/) must be stopped.‚Äù The memo notes that in March 2020, former [SEC Chairman Jay Clayton](https://dailycaller.com/2017/01/04/trump-nominates-jay-clayton-for-sec-chairman-this-is-how-he-plans-on-unshackling-the-economy/) issued an [order](https://www.sec.gov/files/rules/exorders/2020/34-88393.pdf) to limit the collection of personal information. ‚ÄúI believe the CAT‚Äôs regulatory objectives can be achieved without collection of the most sensitive pieces of retail investor information,‚Äù Clayton said in a [statement](https://www.sec.gov/news/public-statement/statement-clayton-cat-covid-19-nal-cybersecurity-2020-03-17). ‚ÄúIt is important to minimize the impact of any potential data breaches, while also evaluating the need for cybersecurity improvements to the CAT.‚Äù The House Appropriations Committee‚Äôs financial services [spending bill](https://appropriations.house.gov/sites/evo-subsites/republicans-appropriations.house.gov/files/evo-media-document/fy25-fsgg-subcommittee-bill-summary.pdf) would also prohibit the SEC from collecting personal information pertaining to CAT. The bill also [cuts SEC funding](https://www.thinkadvisor.com/2024/06/04/house-spending-bill-cuts-sec-budget-curbs-cat-data-collection/) by $589 million below their requested 2025 fiscal budget and $144.3 million below their current 2024 fiscal budget. Content created by The Daily Caller News Foundation is available without charge to any eligible news publisher that can provide a large audience. For licensing opportunities of our original content, please contact [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection). [SUPPORT TRUTHFUL JOURNALISM. MAKE A DONATION TO THE NONPROFIT WND NEWS CENTER. THANK YOU!](https://wndnewscenter.nationbuilder.com/support_wnd_news_center)

author: VNExplorer
title: Compa√±√≠a china BYD inaugura planta con capacidad de 150.000 veh√≠culos el√©ctricos
text: BYD El gigante chino de los veh√≠culos el√©ctricos BYD inaugur√≥ este jueves una planta en Tailandia, continuando su expansi√≥n internacional a pesar de la desaceleraci√≥n del mercado. (Lea:Kia lleg√≥ al primer lugar de ventas en el mercado nacional) La planta en Rayong, una zona industrial al sureste de Bangkok, podr√° fabricar hasta 150.000 veh√≠culos al a√±o, indic√≥ la compa√±√≠a que domina el mercado chino. Wang Chuanfu, director ejecutivo de BYD, con sede en Shenzhen, afirm√≥ que la producci√≥n se centrar√° inicialmente en veh√≠culos totalmente el√©ctricos y luego se expandir√≠a para incluir h√≠bridos enchufables, que combinan un motor convencional con uno el√©ctrico. (Tambi√©n: BWM deber√° indemnizar a clientes que compraron veh√≠culos con precios 'inflados') "La planta de BYD Tailandia tiene una capacidad anual de 150.000 veh√≠culos, incluidos los cuatro procesos principales de producci√≥n de veh√≠culos y piezas, y crear√° unos 10.000 puestos de trabajo", dijo Wang en la ceremonia de inauguraci√≥n. En el cuarto trimestre de 2023 BYD super√≥ a Tesla y se convirti√≥ en el l√≠der mundial de veh√≠culos el√©ctricos, aunque la compa√±√≠a de Elon Musk volvi√≥ al primer lugar en el primer trimestre de este a√±o. China est√° liderando el cambio global hacia el coche el√©ctrico y se prev√© que en 2030 casi uno de cada tres coches que circulen en sus carreteras ser√° el√©ctrico, seg√∫n la Agencia Internacional de la Energ√≠a. author: @ACBCOM
title: Ave Mario, contra el bullying | ACB.COM
text: El primer d√≠a de la edici√≥n de Navidad del Campus Gigantes Basket Lover cont√≥ con un invitado de lo m√°s especial. El carism√°tico gamer Ave Mario, jugador de E-Sports profesional de los Cavs Legion, quiso colaborar en el programa de la acb y Endesa "Actuamos contra el Bullying", visitando las sedes de San Jos√© del Parque y Noroeste. Te contamos todo al detalle.‚Äî Campus Gigantes BasketüèÄLover (@CampusGigantes) Gran experiencia con el gamer [@avemario32]en [#SedeSanJosedelParque]y [#SedeNoroeste]en la lucha dentro del programa de [@ACBCOM]'Actuamos contra el Bullying' [https://t.co/vPSmHRWlH3] [#JuntosGigantes] [#BasketLover] [pic.twitter.com/nI5Oe4biKp] [December 27, 2023] Ave Mario comparti√≥ su experiencia con los numerosos chicos y chicas participantes en el Campus Gigantes, relatando su experiencia profesional en Estados Unidos, interes√°ndose por si hab√≠an tenido que experimentar alguna vez una situaci√≥n similar y anim√°ndose a responder cada pregunta de los asistentes, a los que mand√≥ un mensaje de conciliaci√≥n para concienciar sobre los peligros del bullying. Adem√°s de su importante labor social, Ave Mario no dud√≥ en firmar aut√≥grafos o retratarse con sus peque√±os y peque√±as fans, cerrando el acto con una foto de familia para el recuerdo.

author: Arthur Caldeira
title: Enchentes na Espanha: MotoGP cancela √∫ltima etapa em Val√™ncia
text: Condi√ß√µes clim√°ticas extremas atingiram a regi√£o e j√° causaram a morte de 205 pessoas; deslizamentos tamb√©m destru√≠ram acessos ao circuito onde aconteceria a prova As enchentes que atingiram a Espanha, nesta semana, obrigaram os organizadores da MotoGP a cancelar a etapa de Val√™ncia. Previsto para acontecer entre 15 e 17 de novembro, o GP de Val√™ncia iria encerrar a temporada da MotoGP , como j√° virou tradi√ß√£o. Os organizadores da competi√ß√£o afirmaram que ir√£o anunciar um novo local e data para a √∫ltima etapa do ano, em breve. ‚ÄúA MotoGP est√° com a Comunidade Valenciana ap√≥s as devastadoras enchentes que afetaram a √°rea. Nossos cora√ß√µes est√£o com todos aqueles que foram perdidos e aqueles que perderam tanto. Estamos em contato constante com as autoridades locais e o circuito para avaliar melhor como podemos ajudar e como devemos proceder‚Äù, disseram os organizadores em nota. At√© hoje, 1/11, o n√∫mero de mortos pelas enchentes confirmado pelas autoridades chegava a 205. Condi√ß√µes clim√°ticas extremas atingiram grande parte da Espanha, nesta semana, com a regi√£o de Val√™ncia sendo uma das mais afetadas. Os deslizamentos de terra, de fato, destru√≠ram completamente algumas partes do circuito Ricardo Tormo , onde acontece a prova. H√° estradas de acesso que desabaram e enormes quantidades de danos. Dif√≠cil imaginar que o local poderia receber um grande pr√™mio da MotoGP, que re√∫ne tr√™s categorias (Moto1, Moto2 e MotoGP) e quase 200 mil pessoas no circuito. Em um comunicado divulgado hoje, os organizadores da MotoGP confirmaram que n√£o correr√£o em Val√™ncia, mas sim por Val√™ncia. ‚ÄúO campeonato colocar√° todos os esfor√ßos coletivos para apoiar os fundos de aux√≠lio j√° existentes e garantir que nosso impacto positivo possa chegar √† √°rea e √†s comunidades atingidas‚Äù. MotoGP na Mal√°sia Neste pr√≥ximo final de semana, 2 e 3/11, a MotoGP disputa a pen√∫ltima etapa da temporada 2024 no circuito de Sepang, na Mal√°sia. O espanhol Jorge Martin (Ducati/ Prima Pramac Racing) lidera a categoria MotoGP, a principal do campeonato, com 453 pontos. O italiano Francesco Bagnaia (Ducati Lenovo Team), da equipe oficial da marca italiana, vem logo atr√°s com 436 pontos. Bagnaia, por√©m, ainda tem chances de virar o jogo, pois h√° 74 pontos em jogo nas duas √∫ltimas etapas. Quer uma navega√ß√£o personalizada?
